image.altText: Lidia Thorpe yelling wearing a fur cloak.

props.synopsis: Independent senator Lidia Thorpe has interrupted a royal reception in Parliament House, yelling "you are not our king" and "this is not your land" to King Charles III.

title.children: 'Give us our land back': Senator Lidia Thorpe escorted out of royal reception after shouting at King Charles

image.altText: cars on the road at sunset

props.synopsis: Toll roads are a part of life for many Australians, but the fees to drive on them, and the fines for not paying, are pushing motorists to the edge. These suburbs are feeling the pinch more than others.

title.children: Transurban made more than $3b in revenue from tolls last financial year. These are the suburbs paying the price

image.altText: Qantas planes sit parked at Sydney Airport, with the city's skyline in the background.

props.synopsis: Qantas is facing a multi-million-dollar compensation bill after it illegally sacked hundreds of workers during the COVID-19 pandemic, with the Federal Court ordering three former employees will receive a share of $170,000.

title.children: Sacked Qantas workers rejoice after airline ordered to pay compensation to hundreds of former staff

image.altText: An illustration of a child walking into a school, wearing a backpack and blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Child abuse prevention researchers say the "huge" problem of child-on-child sex abuse within Australian schools is growing. It's sparked urgent calls to overhaul the curriculum on porn and consent.

title.children: Researchers fear child-on-child sex abuse is becoming a 'huge' problem

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding a glass under a running tap, filling it with water

props.synopsis: The National Health and Medical Research Council has released draft guidelines on limits for four types of "forever chemicals" in drinking water. So how do they compare with other countries such as the US?

title.children: Draft limits of PFAS in Australia's drinking water released by national medical research body

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris celebrates her 60th birthday with a day of campaigning as Donald Trump reveals details of a conversation with Benjamin Netanyahu — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Trump's McDonald's shift and Stevie Wonder serenades Kamala Harris — the latest from the US election campaign

image.altText: Yael Stone sits looking straight with a neutral expression while Jack Manning Bancroft wears a hat backwards, holding a mug

props.synopsis: She turned her back on Hollywood. He collapsed from exhaustion. Unconventional couple Yael Stone and Jack Manning Bancroft reveal the sacrifices they make to live by their convictions.

title.children: When actor Yael Stone walked away from Hollywood, everyone thought she was crazy — except the man who loved her

image.altText: An historic apartment building on a wide street

props.synopsis: A landlord found to have broken the law by turning a one-bedroom Adelaide unit into an apartment with five bedrooms has lost a legal bid to avoid returning the flat to its original state by early next week.

title.children: Landlord whose unit went from one to five bedrooms loses bid to avoid putting it back to its 'original state'

image.altText: Two boys sit on a makeshift white scrap of sheet in front of a port.

props.synopsis: Escalating militant attacks on Chinese investments threaten China's Belt and Road initiative in Pakistan as security concerns dominate talks between the two countries.

title.children: China's 'Silk Road' ambitions threatened by militant attacks

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks into multiple microphones.

props.synopsis: Re-elected MLA Jeremy Hanson says the party's seventh-straight election loss was "very disappointing", as conversations continue about Elizabeth Lee's leadership.

title.children: Jeremy Hanson confirms he will make bid for Canberra Liberals leadership, says the party has 'gone backwards'

image.altText: A woman in red swimsuit

props.synopsis: An Italian surfer has died in a rare and tragic accident after being struck by a swordfish while surfing off Indonesia's West Sumatra coast.

title.children: Surfer dies in freak swordfish accident while catching wave off west coast of Sumatra

image.altText: A low shot looking up at a sign on the side of Perth Children's Hospital.

props.synopsis: A Perth couple are on trial accused of starving their teenage daughter to the point she weighed barely more than 27 kilograms and was at risk of having a heart attack.

title.children: Court hears Perth girl, 17, weighed just 27 kilograms as parents face trial over her malnutrition

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of a young boy leaning on the railing of a rodeo arena.

props.synopsis: The cost of living and a downturn in ticket sales have led to the collapse of the board that runs the famed Mount Isa rodeo.

title.children: Cost of living blamed as largest rodeo in the southern hemisphere enters voluntary administration

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: It was alleged two boys — who cannot be identified as they were 17 years old at the time — broke into the Lovell's house on Boxing Day night in 2022.

title.children: Husband of Brisbane mother killed during home invasion didn’t realise he had also been stabbed until paramedics told him, court hears

image.altText: A woman holds a sign at a Brisbane pro-choice rally in May.

props.synopsis: Labor is accusing conservatives of using abortion as a "political football" while the LNP believes Labor is running a scare campaign.

title.children: Inside the abortion law debate that has been creeping into Australian politics

image.altText: Westpac, St George and CommBank apps on an iPhone screen.

props.synopsis: Thousands of bank customers were affected by Westpac and St George app and internet bank outages and a Commonwealth Bank duplicate transaction error, leading a finance expert to advise Australians to bank with at least two different institutions to mitigate risk.

title.children: Banks give people access to their own money. What happens when they don't work?

image.altText: Flames and smoke rise in the foreground in front of an airport terminal

props.synopsis: Explosions and traffic jams hit parts of Beirut, with hundreds of panicked residents fleeing their homes after Israel took aim at a "large number of targets" linked to Hezbollah's financial arm.

title.children: Blasts rock Beirut as Israel targets Hezbollah financial arm, with IDF strike killing dozens in Gaza

image.altText: A wrinkly cat sits on a lap

props.synopsis: The XL Bully cat, a crossbreed of Sphynx cats and Munchkin cats, is causing global concern due to its rising popularity.

title.children: Wrinkly, stumpy and controversial. Why these internet-famous cats are under the spotlight

image.altText: People walking across a courtyard surrounded by buildings.

props.synopsis: Vice-chancellor Stephen Parker says the University of Canberra is "spending beyond its means" and needs to save about $50 million in recurrent expenditure by the end of next year.

title.children: University of Canberra to cut 200 jobs as part of 'urgent and significant' cost-saving measures

image.altText: A man it a suit sits behind a microphone in a council chamber

props.synopsis: Townsville mayor Troy Thompson says he has challenged the state government's intention to remove him from office with a 23-page defence.

title.children: Controversial Queensland mayor mounts defence against government's move to oust him

image.altText: Three men address the media.

props.synopsis: The NT government has revealed plans to permanently transfer children from Alice Springs youth detention to Darwin as part of an "emergency response" aimed at rolling out a thousand new prison beds over the next four years.

title.children: Alice Springs youth to be relocated to Darwin as part of NT government's 'emergency' prisons plan

image.altText: A sepia photograph of a man.

props.synopsis: Survivors of serial paedophile Dennis McKenna hope he is never released from prison.

title.children: 'They've got it very right': Parole denied for prolific child abuser

image.altText: Elon Musk wearing a black blazer jacket over a grey t-shirt in front of a projection of the US flag

props.synopsis: The Tesla and SpaceX co-founder says he will make daily payments to people who sign his online petition in support of the US Constitution.

title.children: Legal concerns raised over Elon Musk's $US1 million payouts to US voters

image.altText: Max Verstappen smiles at Lando Norris

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen was able to extend his lead in the Formula 1 drivers championship after rival Lando Norris was hit was a controversial 5-second penalty after a late overtaking manoeuvrer on the defending champion.

title.children: Controversial penalty hands Max Verstappen F1 title advantage

image.altText: black and white portrait of Thom Yorke holding his right hand up over his face

props.synopsis: In an exclusive interview, Thom Yorke tells us about Russian spy terms, his upcoming Australian tour, and how the success of Radiohead gives him artistic freedom with new band The Smile.

title.children: Thom Yorke loves working with The Smile and doesn't care if you want Radiohead to reform

image.altText: AFLW player Chloe Dalton and partner Riley Bodger with sonogram pictures.

props.synopsis: AFLW star and Olympic gold medallist Chloe Dalton is expecting her first child later this month after going through IVF with her partner Riley, and she hopes there are more open discussions about fertility in the women's sporting space.

title.children: AFLW great says young stars should have fertility conversations as early as possible

image.altText: Alanna Smith in tears during game five of the WNBA Finals

props.synopsis: Opals coach Sandy Brondello leads the New York Liberty to its first WNBA championship at the expense of fellow Australian Alanna Smith and the Minnesota Lynx.

title.children: Coach accuses refs of 'stealing' WNBA title as Australian star called for dubious late foul in overtime loss

image.altText: Vials of vaccines stack up along a conveyor belt

props.synopsis: New COVID-19 strains are emerging and with it the need for updated vaccines to protect people from the virus. So how do researchers quickly update shots to keep up with mutations?

title.children: Vaccine makers are working quickly to avoid letting another COVID-19 'escape' variant take off

image.altText: Cars driving on a boulevard during a blackout.

props.synopsis: The hurricane made landfall in Cuba as a category one on the weekend, further burdening a nation already struggling to keep the lights on.

title.children: Hurricane Oscar makes landfall as Cuba struggles with fourth power outage in 48 hours

image.altText: A child walks down a red dirt road in front of a rain-soaked Uluru.

props.synopsis: Tourism operators are calling on Parks Australia to urgently upgrade the Uluru base walk to an all-weather track, after years of intermittent rain closures hurting local businesses.

title.children: Uluru track closures in wet weather costing tourism operators at Australia's 'crown jewel'

image.altText: Referee Chris Young gives Australian boxer Tim Tszyu a standing count during a fight.

props.synopsis: After a vicious beating at the hands of Russian Bakhram Murtazaliev, Australian Tim Tszyu delays his return to Australia, where he will get more check-ups to ensure he is physically OK.

title.children: Tim Tszyu hospitalised and left searching for answers after brutal TKO loss

image.altText: WA Liberal leader Libby Mettam speaks at a lectern with her head framed by a ring of lights.

props.synopsis: The battlelines for two elections were drawn this weekend, and while they'll be very different affairs given Peter Dutton's team is far stronger than the WA Liberals, state leader Libby Mettam is talking up her party's chances.

title.children: Here's how the Liberal Party plans to win back Western Australia

image.altText: an old car wreck on a dirt road

props.synopsis: A driving school in WA's north is doing its best to reduce Indigenous road deaths, by removing the financial barriers that often prevent people learning to drive safely.

title.children: First Nations people are more likely to die on the roads, but this regional driving school hopes to change that

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff speaking at a lecturn, with Guy Barnett standing next to him.

props.synopsis: The demise of Michael Ferguson could be a word of warning to other ministers. And the new cabinet is full of faces that have fallen foul of the opposition and crossbench in the past.

title.children: A major shift has happened since Tasmania's last election: Instant accountability for ministers
